meanings.definition: To surpass in a competition or argument by using cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She outbitched her opponent by coming up with a clever strategy.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outbitch others in debates to win.
meanings.sent3: The fox outbitched the rabbit in the race by taking a shortcut.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to outbitch her rival was like a well-played chess move.
meanings.sent5: The magician outbitched his rival with a surprising trick.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outsmart someone in a confrontational situation.
meanings.sent1: The detective outbitched the criminal by solving the case quickly.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outbitch her opponent in the final round of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbitched the dog in the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His wit and charm helped him outbitch his rivals in the negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team outbitched the champions in a surprising turn of events.
